docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump intends to nominate Justin Muzinich, an aide to Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin, to be the deputy secretary of the Treasury, the White House said on Monday.

headline.print_headline: Trump to Nominate Muzinich as Treasury Deputy Secretary: White House
headline.main: Trump to Nominate Muzinich as Treasury Deputy Secretary: White House

docs.snippet: An activist art group has staged an exhibit featuring live rats and a Donald Trump impersonator inside a Trump hotel in New York City.

headline.print_headline: Guerrilla Artists Stage Stunt With Live Rats at Trump Hotel
headline.main: Guerrilla Artists Stage Stunt With Live Rats at Trump Hotel

docs.snippet: Shares of Amazon.com Inc fell 6 percent on Monday after U.S. President Donald Trump again attacked the online retailer over the pricing of its deliveries through the United States Postal Service and promised unspecified changes.

headline.print_headline: Amazon Shares Fall 6 Percent as Trump Renews Attack
headline.main: Amazon Shares Fall 6 Percent as Trump Renews Attack

docs.snippet: The special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III, has subpoenaed the Trump Organization for documents related to Russia. The company has a three-decade relationship with Moscow.

headline.print_headline: Mueller Wants Trump’s Business Files. What’s the Russia Connection?
headline.main: Mueller Wants Trump’s Business Records. What’s the Russia Connection?

docs.snippet: The administration is already deliberating over the logistics and location of the meeting, which has still not been officially confirmed by North Korea.

headline.print_headline: Administration Tackles Hurdles Of a Kim Meeting
headline.main: Planning Begins for Kim Jong-un Meeting Some Trump Aides Believe Will Never Happen

docs.snippet: The Latest on "Roseanne" and President Donald Trump (all times local):

headline.print_headline: The Latest: Roseanne Barr Calls Trump Phone Call a 'Thrill'
headline.main: The Latest: Roseanne Barr Calls Trump Phone Call a 'Thrill'

docs.snippet: As far as the stock market is concerned, U.S. President Donald Trump is, right now, his own worst enemy.

headline.print_headline: As Wall Street Sinks, Trump Is His Own Worst Enemy
headline.main: As Wall Street Sinks, Trump Is His Own Worst Enemy

docs.snippet: In vowing Tuesday to use the military on the U.S.-Mexico border until his coveted wall is built, President Donald Trump heaped blame on his predecessor, congressional Democrats and Mexico for creating a dangerous and dysfunctional border.

headline.print_headline: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Misses Mark on State of Mexico Border
headline.main: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Misses Mark on State of Mexico Border

docs.snippet: The president, who is famously fickle, appears to have soured on additional members of his senior leadership team, and some people around him are convinced he could make more moves soon.

headline.print_headline: Six Gone From ‘Phenomenal Team’; How Many More to Go?
headline.main: ‘There Will Always Be Change,’ Trump Says as More Personnel Shake-Ups Loom

docs.snippet: On guns and now trade, President Trump’s public positions have reminded G.O.P. leaders that they can never be 100 percent certain of what they’re going to get with him.

headline.print_headline: Suddenly, the G.O.P. Remembers All Its Doubts on Trump
headline.main: Suddenly, the G.O.P. Remembers All Its Doubts on Trump
